title: Poster, Citicorp Center 3, 1975
medium: Offset lithograph on white wove paper
inscribed:
Imprinted in white upper right: Citicorp Center was just a dream in 1968 / when the land package destined to be its / site was being assembled.  Like all dreams / the details were obscure.  But one thing / was certain: St. Peter's Church, which / had stood on the corner of 54th Street and / Lexington for over 70 years, / would have a new home on that same / corner. /
2nd paragraph in white: Facing the Lexington Avenue side of Citibank's building at 399 Park Avenue, excavation of Citicorp Center's site was / begun in April, 1974.  To reach sound rock / on which the main tower is to stand, it / was necessary in some areas to dig down / fifty feet below grade.  Though completion / is not scheduled before early 1977, con- / struction is already transforming the char- / acter of the block bounded by Lexington / and Third Avenues and 53rd and 54th Streets, as well as the surrounding area.
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman
description: On a gray /silver background, two black and white photographic reproductions of an arial view the Citicorp excavation site are presented side by side. On the left the image shows the site prior to demolition of existing buildings and on the right a view after those buildings have been removed.  In black lower left on edge the number 3. In red across the lower left corner of the right image: CITICORP / CENTER. Two paragraphs of text, imprinted in white at upper right corner. White banding  across lower edge of sheet.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, Citicorp Center 3, 1975. Offset lithograph on white wove paper. 
Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-153
